image1: Darius vase Napoli Museum without background.jpg
caption1: The "Darius Vase" at the Achaeological Museum of Naples. c. 340–320 BC.
image2: Darius detail on the Darius vase.jpg
caption2: Detail of Darius, with a label in Greek (ΔΑΡΕΙΟΣ, top right) giving his name.  In 343 BC, Artaxerxes committed responsibility for the suppression of the Cyprian rebels to Idrieus, prince of Caria, who employed 8,000 Greek mercenaries and forty triremes, commanded by Phocion the Athenian, and Evagoras, son of the elder Evagoras, the Cypriot monarch. |
